>  I=B4m just using to return values. Does anyone here has used it for some=
thing
>  else?

I'm /typically/ using RMock in quite the opposite way, I us=
e the mocks
to create expectations on the mock. The methods that I expect t=
o be
called /typically/ has void as return-type.

Those expectations in ess=
ence replace asserts in those tests so the
mocks are not just tools that al=
low me to respond with data to the
class I'm testing and then assert; they =
exist in order to make sure
that the correct things are passed along from t=
he class I'm testing to
the class I mocked given the stimuli I provide in m=
y test.

I find that it helps me prevent exposing state form my classes and=

keep the operations close to the data in a "tell don't ask" fashion.

Othe=
r people do it differently, obviously that works too :)
